ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3 hours
10 hours
2h
About 5-10 hours.
5-6 hours
~5 per week
6-7 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The assignment or homework is more informative than the lectures. Instructor does not teach how to use ArcMap step by step in class.
excellent
learn useful methods of visualizing data

This course provided a great overview of the wealth of analyses available to use In public health. The only weakness that I found in the course was the lack of a lab section. I think that would help illustrate many points and allow us to Racine the skills as a group, otherwise I really enjoyed the course!
strength: the instruction for each exercise is very clear weakness: due to the instability of Arcgis, there were lots of errors cannot be explained during the whole process
The strength of the class was the excellent coverage of the theory, the professor's knowledge and the wide display of examples.

Great introduction to GIS and the ArcMap software. Actually loved the homework assignments and felt like I really gained a facility with how to use the software to conduct geospatial analysis and make maps. The lectures were fine, but I felt that they were at times a little too heavy on cartographic theory; I would have preferred that they focused more on methods.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Theodore Holford  Good instructor. But he cannot give good feedback when we have some questions on how to use the software. We often felt that it was better to handle the question by ourselves than asking him.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  excellent and nice
Instructor: Theodore Holford  A decent and nice professor. He has excellent knowledge of biostatistics. However, sometimes he is not familiar with the software.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  nice professor

Instructor: Theodore Holford  He was very knowledgeable about the subject and always did a great job explaining the different analyses. He was also very flexible and adapted the course to our interests.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  good
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Very knowledgeable and willing to help.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Finishing the assignments and reading the slides are enough for learning the techniques taught in this course. You do not need to attend the course.
This course deserves your time.
yes, learn useful ways to visualize data
it's an useful course

Great intro to GIS, although some of Professor Holford's lectures were very theory-oriented (when I would have preferred a more methods-oriented focus), and thus were not very engaging. You will, however, come away with a solid grasp of how to use the ArcGIS software.
I would recommend it. I wish we had had a lab section.
